image.altText: Premier Peter Malinauskas walks alongside three people on a congested street

props.synopsis: The South Australian government wants to increase the size of parking spaces in garages for new residential builds, but the opposition and industry groups say it will just make properties more expensive for buyers.Â

title.children: Larger garages planned in bid to curb on-street parking congestion in SA

image.altText: A man with grey hair and grey moustache wearing a dark polo top

props.synopsis: The brother of murder victim Joanne Lillecrapp says her killer Nicole Therese Courcier McGuinness is a "monster" who should not be granted a fourth chance of parole. McGuinness murdered Ms Lillecrap in 2001 and buried her remains in a strawberry patch.

title.children: Brother of murder victim tells court 'monster' does not deserve parole

image.altText: Elderly lady and man with a beard, sitting at bench with a cup of tea and ipad, looking at camera

props.synopsis: Ageing boomers, a nursing shortage, and a federal capital works system labelled as a "lottery" are forcing some older residents to separate from their families, some regional aged care providers say.

title.children: Aged care residents forced to find a bed hundreds of kilometres away from home

image.altText: SA Liberal MP Jing Lee at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Jing Lee is the latest MP to have left the ranks of the SA Liberals, and while her former colleagues have been much kinder about her resignation than about those of some of her predecessors, the party is becoming all too familiar with defections.

title.children: Jing Lee's defection is the latest in a long line by SA Liberals

image.altText: A great white shark looking at the camera almost looking like its smiling with its mouth open.

props.synopsis: While scientists say increasing electronic monitoring of white sharks across South Australia's coastline could help warn beachgoers of imminent danger, the state government has other ideas.

title.children: Scientists back acoustic tagging of sharks as part of wider warning system for SA

image.altText: Bike crash at the Tour Down Under

props.synopsis: A New South Wales woman is in hospital after suffering significant injuries while watching the prelude to the men's race at the Tour Down Under.Â

title.children: Female spectator suffers serious injuries after cyclists crash into safety barriers

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A South Australian man has been arrested after trying to evade police by swimming into the ocean following a high-speed pursuit through Adelaide's western suburbs.

title.children: Driver swims into ocean to evade police following high-speed pursuit

image.altText: Elizabeth Dalman spreads her arms wide as she stands in front of ADT dancers

props.synopsis: Modern dance pioneer and rebel Elizabeth Dalman is returning to her roots in a new production by a leading Australian arts company.

title.children: 90-year-old rebel with a cause returns for new dance show

image.altText: Novak Djokovic fires up the Serbian fans at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: The Serbian Council of Australia is calling for the resignation of Nine presenter Tony Jones after his comments to fans about Novak Djokovic at the Australian Open. Follow live.

title.children: Former Aus Open champ says Djokovic's skin 'a little thin' but he's earned respect

image.altText: Donald Trump in suit pumps fist as crowd looks on

props.synopsis: Donald Trump lands in Washington, DC ahead of a pre-inauguration rally.Â

title.children: Trump says he will repeal 'foolish' orders within hours of taking office

image.altText: Security footage showing a large fire burning on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the Dover Heights property last Friday morning after two cars were set alight and one was spray-painted with the words "f*** Jews".

title.children: CCTV footage released of attack on Jewish leader's former Sydney home

image.altText: Suspect I Wayan Agus Suartama seen from behind in court

props.synopsis: An Indonesian man faces two charges relating to the alleged sexual assault of a university student â and could later face further prosecution with up to 17 women and girls, including two minors, making allegations against him.

title.children: Accused man born without arms denies committing sexual crimes

image.altText: Photo of health service sign

props.synopsis: A group of doctors outraged by last year's abortion ban at Orange hospital in regional NSW say they have lodged a complaint with the state's corruption watchdog.

title.children: 'We are heartbroken and incensed': Doctors demand action after Orange abortion ban

image.altText: A woman in a red hat leaning on a rusty bar of a gate.

props.synopsis: Think you earn a decent salary? The latest inequality report from Oxfam found Australia's billionaires took home 1,300 times more than the average Aussie earner last year.Â

title.children: Australian billionaires made $67,000 an hour last year, report finds

image.altText: Dutton speaks to a Jewish man standing inside a synagogue courtyard.

props.synopsis: Amid a summer of violence against Jewish synagogues and homes, the Coalition vows stronger penalties for acts of anti-Semitism, and repeats its call for a national cabinet to be convened on the issue.

title.children: Coalition vows minimum jail terms for anti-Semitic acts

image.altText: A long-lens view of Gaza's skyline showing many buildings in rubble or partly destroyed.

props.synopsis: Hamas returns three Israeli hostages and displaced Gazans begin to return to what's left of their communities as day one of a ceasefire gets off to a shaky start.Â

title.children: Ceasefire holds for now as Hamas down but not defeated

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment shares fall in early trade as the casino operator continues to seek a financial lifeline, while the broader market heads higher. Trump launches a meme coin ahead of his inauguration. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Star warns investors of 'material uncertainty', ASX rises

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Donald and Melania Trump's meme coin fortunes
ASX 200 up 0.3pc, lifted by miners and banks

image.altText: A woman with dark hair against a white background

props.synopsis: As the mystery and intrigue deepen, millions of Indians want to know: What hope is there, truly, that Nimisha Priya might be spared?Â

title.children: An Indian nurse killed a man in Yemen. His family will determine her fate

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Young girl smiling and painting

props.synopsis: When Jung Yoon moved to Australia from South Korea in 1995, she had never encountered a person with a disability before, but that changed when she had her daughter Joanne. Now she is dedicating her life to help people with cognitive disability have better employment opportunities.Â

title.children: Inclusive hiring at the heart of project for people with cognitive impairment

image.altText: A man wearing a cowboy hat and blue shirt leans against a gate

props.synopsis: Long before motorbikes were used for mustering, Ron Woodall had been breaking in horses on stations. He has spent his life in the world of bucking bulls and broncs, becoming a legend in the rodeo community.

title.children: Rodeo legend notches up 70 years among the toughest broncs and bulls

image.altText: A flooded roadway in the Pilbara

props.synopsis: Severe Tropical Cyclone Sean is upgraded to a category three system off the coast of Western Australia as it impacts residents in the state's far north.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Sean drops 20-year record rain, cutting off towns by road

image.altText: A man about to put a coin into a white piggy bank with other stacks of coins sitting next to the piggy bank

props.synopsis: The federal government should intervene to help retirees spend their superannuation and avoid the savings system ending up as "a massive inheritance scheme", the Grattan Institute warns. Â

title.children: Australian retirees sitting on their super rather than spending it

image.altText: two men holding a scout drone which is part of a research project for the anu to find new ways to fight fires

props.synopsis: With wildfires raging across Los Angeles, focus is turning to how new technologies, including AI, can aid our response to future disasters,. But there are concerns Australia isn't ready to combat fires all year round.

title.children: Experts warn Australia 'doesn't have tools' to fight large bushfires

image.altText: NSW Housing Minister Rose Jackson stands behind a microphone at an outdoor presser

props.synopsis: The NSW government says it will take the state's public sector psychiatrists to the Industrial Relations Commission over their mass threats to resign on Tuesday.

title.children: Government seeks 'urgent intervention' amid psychiatrist resignation threats

image.altText: A woman cries in front of a car.

props.synopsis: Two leading lawyers and a juror reveal what goes on behind the scenes of a high-profile murder trial, as Victoria's Supreme Court prepares for the Erin Patterson triple-murder case later this year.

title.children: 'Did she do it?': Jurors to answer key question of the mushroom cook case

image.altText: A big red-brown rock in front of a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in western Victoria say a draft management plan for Mt Arapiles-Tooan State Park has re-ignited racial abuse and harassment of Aboriginal people online and in the community.

title.children: Aboriginal people say Mt Arapiles climbing ban has sparked racist backlash

image.altText: A woman holds a hot water bottle against her stomach.

props.synopsis: A new study has found almost four in five Australian women have experienced problematic periods in the past five years, and almost half of those have missed days of work or study, costing about $14 billion a year in lost productivity.

title.children: Periods in spotlight as research highlights personal and economic cost

image.altText: Close up of flat white in coffee cup with $5.50 in change

props.synopsis: Industry insiders say coffee lovers â even in regional Australia â are unlikely to escape paying more for their flat whites as cafes are forced to push up prices.Â

title.children: Flat white price likely to skyrocket this year, no matter where you live

image.altText: Two young Afghan girls sit at a wooden desk, one writing with a pen and one reading.

props.synopsis: In a rare public rebuke, the foreign ministry deputy calls on the Taliban's leadership to end the ban on education for Afghan women and girls.

title.children: Senior Taliban official urges reversal of education ban on Afghan girls

image.altText: Shot of teenage boy in park in front of tree

props.synopsis: Kian Guerreiroâs family thought his crushing fatigue was due to puberty. They never imagined the active teenager was fighting off melioidosis.Â

title.children: A deadly bacteria found in dirt almost claimed teen's life

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz looks annoyed, holding his head in his hands with a towel

props.synopsis: The US ban of TikTok has some feeling glum, while a hot-temper in the Aussie heat has burnt a hole in Medvedev's pocket. Here are the five quick hits from day eight of the Australian Open.

title.children: Quick hits: 'Crazy' clocks, TikTok turmoil and racquet smashing fines

image.altText: A rusted out shipwreck in the ocean with a small island in the background

props.synopsis: HMAS Protector, crumbling offshore of Heron Island, played an important part in Australia's naval history and is now a marine paradise providing security for fish, turtles, rays, and sharks.

title.children: HMAS Protector, bought for just 10 pounds, now a marine paradise off Heron Island

props.synopsis: Starring Selena Gomez and Zoe Saldana, this musical telenovela about a trans cartel kingpin was a hit at Cannes and has already won a Golden Globe. So why is it copping so much criticism elsewhere?Â

title.children: Emilia Perez is a star-studded Oscars favourite but it's also proving controversial
